alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:41PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Benewah and southern Kootenai Counties through 730 PM PDT... At 640 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Parkline to St. Maries. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St. Maries, Plummer, Harrison, Parkline, Worley, Medimont, and Chatcolet. This includes U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 386 and 409, and between mile markers 412 and 417. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near southern portion of Lake Coeur d`Alene, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse
